Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Propensity \Pro*pen"si*ty\, n.; pl. {Propensities}. The quality or state of being propense; natural inclination; disposition to do good or evil; bias; bent; tendency. ``A propensity to utter blasphemy.'' --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Disposition; bias; inclination; proclivity; proneness; bent; tendency. [1913 Webster]

propensity n 1: an inclination to do something; "he felt leanings toward frivolity" [syn: {leaning}, {tendency}] 2: a natural inclination; "he has a proclivity for exaggeration" [syn: {proclivity}, {leaning}] 3: a disposition to behave in a certain way; "the aptness of iron to rust"; "the propensity of disease to spread" [syn: {aptness}]
